com.apriori.apt.reflect

Class ArAnnotationBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.apt.reflect.ArAnnotationBridge

  • public final class ArAnnotationBridge
extends Object
    Bridges an annotation mirror into an actual annotation interface. The trick is that classes may not be available as actual Class tokens at runtime since they may refer to classes that are not yet compiled. So the bridge provides a way to access these class references as instances of ArClass instead.

    For example, take the following definition: 

      @interface AnnoXyz {
    Class<? extends Closeable>[] arrayOfClasses();
 }

    And let's say we're processing the following code: 

      @AnnoXyz(SomeClass.class, Writer.class, Reader.class)
 class SomeClass implements Closeable {
    // ...
 }
    This means that we can access the annotation in an annotation processor like so: 
     // The bridge is an instance of the AnnoXyz annotation.
 AnnoXyz annotation = createBridge(ArClass.forName("SomeClass"), AnnoXyz.class);
       
 // Since classes might not be available, annotation fields that return classes or
 // arrays of classes will instead return null.
 annotation.arrayOfClasses() == null; // true! 
 
 // So the bridge to the rescue!
 ArClass classes[] = bridge(annotation.arrayOfClasses());
 // Yay!
 classes[0].getName(); // "SomeClass" ftw!

    So use createBridge(ArAnnotation) to create an instance of an annotation interface based on a ArAnnotation. And then use bridge(Class) or bridge(Class[]) to access class tokens returned from that interface. You can optionally use bridge(Object) to access other fields returned from the interface, for consistency, but it's not necessary.

    Since the annotation method actually returns null, the bridge(Class) method doesn't actually "convert" the incoming argument. In reality, the call to the annotation method sets thread-local state about the bridged value, which is then accessed via the call to bridge(Class).

    • Method Detail

      • createBridge

        public static <T extends Annotation> T createBridge(ArAnnotation annotation,
                                                    Class<T> clazz)
        Creates an annotation bridge. The returned annotation acts as would a real runtime annotation that had the same values as the specified ArAnnotation (which itself comes from an annotation mirror).

        They key differences between an actual java.lang.annotation.Annotation and the value returned follow:

        • The returned value does not implement equals(Object) or hashCode() per the contract specified by Annotation. Bridged annotations can safely be compared to one another but not to actual (non-bridge) annotation objects.
        • Methods that return java.lang.Class or java.lang.Class[] values will always return null. Callers must use bridge(Class) or bridge(Class[]) to get to these values, but as ArClass objects instead of as Class tokens.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the annotation type
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation to be bridged
        clazz - the annotation type
        Returns:
        an annotation bridge
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified type is not actually an annotation type or if the specified annotation is not of the specified type
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null

      • createBridge

        public static <T extends Annotation> T createBridge(ArClass annotatedClass,
                                                    Class<T> annotationType)
        Queries for an annotation and creates a bridge for it. This will query the given annotated class for an annotation of the specified type, and then construct a bridge for it. If the given class has no such annotation, null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the annotation type
        Parameters:
        annotatedClass - the class to which the annotation belongs
        annotationType - the type of the annotation to query
        Returns:
        an bridge for the annotation of the given type on the given class or null if the class has no such annotation
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null
        See Also:
        createBridge(ArAnnotation, Class)

      • createBridge

        public static Annotation createBridge(ArAnnotation annotation)
                               throws ClassNotFoundException
        Creates an annotation bridge.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation to be bridged
        Returns:
        an annotation bridge
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if no runtime java.lang.Class could be loaded for the type of the specified annotation
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        See Also:
        createBridge(ArAnnotation, Class)

      • createBridge

        public static Annotation createBridge(ArAnnotation annotation,
                                      ClassLoader classLoader)
                               throws ClassNotFoundException
        Creates an annotation bridge. The specified class loader is used in the attempt to load the annotation type.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation to be bridged
        classLoader - a class loader
        Returns:
        an annotation bridge
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if no runtime java.lang.Class could be loaded for the type of the specified annotation
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null
        See Also:
        createBridge(ArAnnotation, Class)

      • bridge

        public static ArClass bridge(Class<?> val)
        Bridges an annotation value from java.lang.Class to ArClass. The value returned from invoking a method on the bridge instance is what should be supplied as the argument to this method.
        Parameters:
        val - the value returned from an annotation bridge (which will actually always be null and should be supplied as an argument to make the syntax more readable)
        Returns:
        the ArClass object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the method appears to be used incorrectly

      • bridge

        public static ArClass[] bridge(Class<?>[] val)
        Bridges an annotation value from java.lang.Class[] to Class[]. The value returned from invoking a method on the bridge instance is what should be supplied as the argument to this method.
        Parameters:
        val - the value returned from an annotation bridge (which will actually always be null and should be supplied as an argument to make the syntax more readable)
        Returns:
        the ArClass object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the method appears to be used incorrectly

      • bridge

        public static <T> T bridge(T val)
        Bridges an annotation value. This is not necessary for values that are not class tokens (or arrays of class tokens) but is provided so code can access methods on the annotation bridge consistently, always using a bridge(...) method. The value returned from invoking a method on the bridge instance is what should be supplied as the argument to this method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the annotation value
        Parameters:
        val - the value returned from an annotation bridge
        Returns:
        the supplied value
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the method appears to be used incorrectly
